parameters.name: Subscriptions
parameters.query:
summarize by subscriptionId
| project value = strcat("/subscriptions/", subscriptionId), label = subscriptionId, selected = iff(subscriptionId =~ '{DefaultSubscription_Internal}', true, false)

parameters.name: Workspaces
parameters.query:
where type =~ 'microsoft.operationalinsights/workspaces'
| project id, selected = iff(id =~ todynamic('{DefaultSubscription_Internal}').ws, true, false), custId= properties.customerId

parameters.name: Servers
parameters.label: Gateway Servers
parameters.description: This param is used to group only servers which are used as OMS Gateway and allow for specific server selection
parameters.query:
Heartbeat
| where IsGatewayInstalled == 'true' 
| distinct Computer
| order by Computer asc

parameters.name: PerfTest
parameters.description: This param is used to check if at one OMS Gateway perf counter has been collected over the time range for the selected server(s). No result could lead to a wrong or none perf counter collection configuration.
parameters.query:
Perf
| where Computer in ({Servers})
| where CounterPath contains "OMS Gateway"
| top 1 by TimeGenerated desc

parameters.name: EventTest
parameters.description: This param is used to check if at one OMS Gateway event has been collected over the time range for the selected server(s). No result could lead to a wrong or none event collection configuration.
parameters.query:
Event
| where Computer in ({Servers})
| where EventLog == "OMS Gateway Log"
| top 1 by TimeGenerated desc

content.json:
>** Author **
>[Bruno Gabrielli](mailto:bruno.gabrielli@microsoft.com)
>
>** Version 1.5 **
>2020-12-09
>* Added the Show Help parameter. You can select if you wish to see help for initial configuration (Get Started part) or if you wich to see the this Change Log.
>* Added GetStarted section with documentation to follow to enable Diagnostic Settings for log collection.
>
>** Version 1.4 **
>2020-09-24
>- Added detail pane view for forbidden hosts, certificates and proxy URLs to make easier the copy/paste when adding them as allowed.
>
>** Version 1.3 **
>2020-04-06
>- Added checks to hide event log and perf counter groups if no data is available. In place of them, a text which reminds to check for the correct onboarding is shown.
>
>** Version 1.2 **
>2020-04-02
>- Added the rejection perf counter chart
>
>** Version 1.1 **
>2020-04-01
>- Added the *Gateway Servers* parameter to allow selection
>- Added dedicated *Gateway communication* group containing pie-chart and list of gateway servers communication status
>- Added the *Computer* field in some of the list based tiles to allow server recognition for generated events
>
>** Version 1.0 **
>2019-11-14
> - Initial version

# Get Started #

-------------------------

Welcome to the Log Analytics Gateway workbook. This workbook is designed to provide you with an understanding of how the Log Analytics Gateway (aka OMS Gateway) is behaving and performing. In this workbook you will find info about:

1. **Gateway Communication** - Is your gateway correctly communicating? When was the last heartbeat received by Log Analytics?

2. **Agents communication** - Are your agents correctly sending data through the Log Analytics Gateway? When was the last heartbeat received by Log Analytics?

3. **Forbidden hosts and certificates** - In these tiles you can get a clear understanding about communication flow from specific agent(s) blocked by the Log Analytics Gateway itself. You can, hence approve these agents by adding the necessary *allowed certificate(s)* or *allowed host(s)*.

4. **Gateway connection issues** - Can your gateway correctly send data, through the configured company proxy or firewall, to Log Analytics?

5. **Gateway performance indicators** - What is the resource (CPU. Memory, specific counters) consumption on the Log Analytics Gateway server(s)? Is there any rejection?

For additional information about the Log Analytics Gateway, see [Connect computers without internet access by using the Log Analytics gateway in Azure Monitor](https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/azure-monitor/platform/gateway).

## Requirements ##

* A [Log Analytics workspace.](https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/azure-monitor/platform/design-logs-deployment?WT.mc_id=Portal-fx)

In order to work, the workbook needs the following:

* Windows Event Logs:

	* Application

	* System

	* OMS Gateway Log
	
  If you're unfamiliar with how to enable Windows Event collection, see [Collect Windows event log data sources with Log Analytics agent](https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/azure-monitor/platform/data-sources-windows-events)

* Windows Performance Counters:

	* Memory(*)\Available Mbytes

	* OMS Gateway(*)\Active Client Connection

	* OMS Gateway(*)\Connected Client

	* OMS Gateway(*)\Connected Client - Realtime

	* OMS Gateway(*)\Error Count

	* OMS Gateway(*)\Rejection Count

	* Processor(*)\% Processor Time
	
  If you're unfamiliar with how to enable Performance Counter collection, see [Collect Windows and Linux performance data sources with Log Analytics agent](https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/azure-monitor/platform/data-sources-performance-counters)
⚠ A subscription has not yet been selected. Select a subscription under the `Subscriptions` dropdown or refresh the workbook.
⚠ A workspace has not yet been selected. Select a workspace under the `Workspaces` dropdown or refresh the workbook.

⚠ No OMS Gateway related performance counters were detected in the selected workspace for the specified time period (`{TimeRange:label}`). Either try a broader time range, select a different workspace, or onboard virtual machines to the selected workspace `{Workspaces:label}`.

If you choose to onboard virtual machines to workspace `{Workspaces:label}`, follow the instruction in the following link: [Azure Monitor for VMs (preview)](https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/azure-monitor/insights/vminsights-overview).

Check also if the correct Event Log collection configuration was performed, following the instruction at [Windows and Linux performance data sources in Azure Monitor](https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/azure-monitor/platform/data-sources-performance-counters).

⚠ No OMS Gateway related events were detected in the selected workspace for the specified time period (`{TimeRange:label}`). Either try a broader time range, select a different workspace, or onboard virtual machines to the selected workspace `{Workspaces:label}`.

If you choose to onboard virtual machines to workspace `{Workspaces:label}`, follow the instruction in the following link: [Azure Monitor for VMs](https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/azure-monitor/insights/vminsights-overview).

Check also if the correct Event Log collection configuration was performed, following the instruction at [Windows event log data sources in Azure Monitor](https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/azure-monitor/platform/data-sources-windows-events).
**Gateway server(s) communication over the last 1 hour.**

content.query:
let OMSGW_IP = Heartbeat 
| where Computer in ({Servers})
| distinct ComputerIP;
Heartbeat 
| where Computer in ({Servers})
| summarize lastCall = max(TimeGenerated) by Computer 
| extend commState=iif(lastCall > ago(1h), "GATEWAY(S) COMMUNICATING","GATEWAY(S) NOT COMMUNICATING") 
| summarize computers=count(Computer) by commState

let OMSGW_IP = Heartbeat 
| where Computer in ({Servers})
| distinct ComputerIP;
Heartbeat
| where Computer in ({Servers})
| summarize lastCommunication = max(TimeGenerated) by Computer 
| extend State = iff(lastCommunication < ago(1h), 'NOT COMMUNICATING', 'COMMUNICATING')
| extend TimeFromNow = now() - lastCommunication
| extend ["TimeAgo"] = strcat(case(TimeFromNow < 2m, strcat(toint(TimeFromNow / 1m), ' seconds'), TimeFromNow < 2h, strcat(toint(TimeFromNow / 1m), ' minutes'), TimeFromNow < 2d, strcat(toint(TimeFromNow / 1h), ' hours'), strcat(toint(TimeFromNow / 1d), ' days')), ' ago')
| project Computer, ["Last Communication on"]=strcat('🕒 ', TimeAgo), State
| sort by State desc nulls first

let OMSGW_IP = Heartbeat 
| where Computer in ({Servers})
| distinct ComputerIP;
Heartbeat 
| where Computer !in ({Servers})
| where ComputerIP in (OMSGW_IP) 
| summarize lastCall = max(TimeGenerated) by Computer 
| extend commState=iif(lastCall > ago(1h), "AGENTS COMMUNICATING","AGENTS NOT COMMUNICATING") 
| summarize computers=count(Computer) by commState

let OMSGW_IP = Heartbeat 
| where Computer in ({Servers})
| distinct ComputerIP;
Heartbeat
| where Computer !in ({Servers})
| where ComputerIP in (OMSGW_IP) 
| summarize lastCommunication = max(TimeGenerated) by Computer 
| extend State = iff(lastCommunication < ago(1h), 'NOT COMMUNICATING', 'COMMUNICATING')
| extend TimeFromNow = now() - lastCommunication
| extend ["TimeAgo"] = strcat(case(TimeFromNow < 2m, strcat(toint(TimeFromNow / 1m), ' seconds'), TimeFromNow < 2h, strcat(toint(TimeFromNow / 1m), ' minutes'), TimeFromNow < 2d, strcat(toint(TimeFromNow / 1h), ' hours'), strcat(toint(TimeFromNow / 1d), ' days')), ' ago')
| project Computer, ["Last Communication on"]=strcat('🕒 ', TimeAgo), State
| sort by State desc nulls first

Event
| where Computer in ({Servers})
| where EventLog == "OMS Gateway Log"
| where EventID == 105
| project RenderedDescription
| parse kind=regex RenderedDescription with * "\\(" targetHost "\\)"
| summarize forbiddenHostNumber=dcount(targetHost)
| project forbiddenHostNumber
content.title: Forbidden Hosts (EventID 105)

content.query:
Event
| where Computer in ({Servers})
| where EventLog == "OMS Gateway Log"
| where EventID==105
| project RenderedDescription, Computer
| parse kind=regex RenderedDescription with * "\\(" targetHost "\\)"
| distinct targetHost, Computer
content.title: List of forbidden hosts
content.noDataMessage: No events with ID 105, indicating forbidden hosts, were found.

content.query:
let certs = Event
| where Computer in ({Servers})
| where EventLog == "OMS Gateway Log"
| where EventID == 106
//| where RenderedDescription contains "O=Microsoft, OU=Microsoft Monitoring Agent, CN" 
| project RenderedDescription, Computer
| parse kind=regex RenderedDescription with * "\\(" targetCert "\\)"
| where targetCert != "";
let certs2 = Event
| where Computer in ({Servers})
| where EventLog == "OMS Gateway Log"
| where EventID == 106
| where RenderedDescription contains "O=Microsoft, OU=Microsoft Monitoring Agent, CN" 
| project RenderedDescription, Computer
| parse kind=regex RenderedDescription with * "CN=" targetCert ", DC"
| where targetCert != "";
let certs3 = Event
| where Computer in ({Servers})
| where EventLog == "OMS Gateway Log"
| where EventID == 106
| where RenderedDescription contains "Server certificate subject is not in allowed list" 
| project EventData, Computer
| parse EventData with * 'CN=' targetCert '</Data>' *
| where targetCert != ""
| extend annotation = "Should be added as host"
| project targetCert, Computer, annotation;
union withsource=SourceTable certs, certs2, certs3
|summarize forbiddenCertsNumber=dcount(targetCert)
| project forbiddenCertsNumber
content.title: Forbidden Certificates (EventID 106)

content.query:
let certs = Event
| where Computer in ({Servers})
| where EventLog == "OMS Gateway Log"
| where EventID == 106
//| where RenderedDescription contains "O=Microsoft, OU=Microsoft Monitoring Agent, CN" 
| project RenderedDescription, Computer
| parse kind=regex RenderedDescription with * "\\(" targetCert "\\)"
| where targetCert != ""
| distinct Computer, targetCert;
let certs2 = Event
| where Computer in ({Servers})
| where EventLog == "OMS Gateway Log"
| where EventID == 106
| where RenderedDescription contains "O=Microsoft, OU=Microsoft Monitoring Agent, CN" 
| project RenderedDescription, Computer
| parse kind=regex RenderedDescription with * "CN=" targetCert ", DC"
| where targetCert != ""
| distinct Computer, targetCert;
let certs3 = Event
| where Computer in ({Servers})
| where EventLog == "OMS Gateway Log"
| where EventID == 106
| where RenderedDescription contains "Server certificate subject is not in allowed list" 
| project EventData, Computer
| parse EventData with * 'CN=' targetCert '</Data>' *
| where targetCert != ""
| extend annotation = "Should be added using the Add-OMSGatewayAllowedHost command."
| project targetCert, Computer, annotation
| distinct targetCert, Computer, annotation;
union withsource=SourceTable certs, certs2, certs3
| project targetCert, Computer, annotation
content.title: List of forbidden certificates
content.noDataMessage: No events with ID 106, indicating forbidden certificates, were found.

content.query:
Event
| where Computer in ({Servers})
| where EventLog =~ "OMS Gateway Log"
| where EventID == 406
| project RenderedDescription
| parse kind=regex RenderedDescription with * "http\\:\\/\\/" proxyUrl "\\/"
| summarize numOfProxyUrl = dcount(proxyUrl)
//| project numOfProxyUrl
content.title: Proxy URL with connection Issues (EventID 406)

content.query:
Event
| where Computer in ({Servers})
| where EventLog =~ "OMS Gateway Log"
| where EventID == 406
| project RenderedDescription, Computer
| parse kind=regex RenderedDescription with * "http\\:\\/\\/" proxyUrl "\\/"
| distinct proxyUrl, Computer
content.title: List of Proxy URL with connection Issues (EventID 406)
content.noDataMessage: No events with ID 406, indicating connection issues, were found.

content.query:
Perf
| where Computer in ({Servers})
| where CounterName=="Connected Client - Realtime"
| summarize Value=avg(CounterValue) by Computer, bin(TimeGenerated, 5min)
content.title: OMS Gateway\Connected Client - Realtime

content.query:
Perf
| where Computer in ({Servers})
| where CounterName=="Rejection Count"
| summarize Value=avg(CounterValue) by Computer, bin(TimeGenerated, 5min)
content.title: OMS Gateway\Rejection Count

content.query:
Perf
| where Computer in ({Servers})
| where CounterName=="% Processor Time"
| summarize Value=avg(CounterValue) by Computer, bin(TimeGenerated, 5min)
content.title: Processor\% Processor Time

content.query:
Perf
| where Computer in ({Servers})
| where CounterName=="Available MBytes"
| summarize Value=avg(CounterValue) by Computer, bin(TimeGenerated, 5min)
content.title: Memory\Available MBytes
